conclusion: Three colored liquids are released from containers at the top, labeled A (white), B (green), and C (pink). The liquids flow down through a system of colored baffles/sticks. At the bottom are house-shaped containers labeled D, E, F, and G (from left to right). The task is to determine which bottom container each liquid will reach.
The white liquid from A flows downward and encounters the light blue/turquoise baffle, which diverts it to the left.
The white liquid from A continues flowing along the leftmost path and reaches the far left side.

premise: The white liquid from A flows downward, encounters the light blue baffle, is diverted to the left, and follows the leftmost path to the far left side.
conclusion: The white liquid from A flows into container D (leftmost container).
The green liquid from B flows straight down initially and touches the red baffle, which diverts it slightly.
The green liquid from B continues following a path through the center-right of the board and reaches the orange-colored house.

premise: The green liquid from B flows straight down, touches the red baffle, is diverted slightly, and follows a path through the center-right of the board to the orange-colored house.
conclusion: The green liquid from B flows into container F (the orange house).
The pink liquid from C flows downward from the right side and encounters the yellow baffle, which affects its path.
The pink liquid from C flows toward the center, interacts with multiple baffles, and follows a complex path across multiple baffles.

premise: The pink liquid from C flows downward, encounters the yellow baffle, is affected in its path, interacts with multiple baffles, and follows a complex path.
conclusion: The pink liquid from C flows into container E (the pink house).

premise: The white liquid from A flows into container D. The green liquid from B flows into container F. The pink liquid from C flows into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from A (white) → Container D; Liquid from B (green) → Container F; Liquid from C (pink) → Container E.
